description: Creates an Amazon Q Business application.

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: A name for the Amazon Q Business application.

parameters.name: clientIdsForOIDC
parameters.description: The OIDC client ID for a Amazon Q Business application. (string) ---

parameters.name: encryptionConfiguration
parameters.description: The identifier of the KMS key that is used to encrypt your data. Amazon Q Business doesn't support asymmetric keys. kmsKeyId (string) --- The identifier of the KMS key. Amazon Q Business doesn't support asymmetric keys.

nested_params.name: kmsKeyId
nested_params.description: The identifier of the KMS key. Amazon Q Business doesn't support asymmetric keys.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A list of key-value pairs that identify or categorize your Amazon Q Business application. You can also use tags to help control access to the application. Tag keys and values can consist of Unicode letters, digits, white space, and any of the following symbols: _ . : / = + - @. (dict) --- A list of key/value pairs that identify an index, FAQ, or data source. The key for the tag. Keys are not case sensitive and must be unique for the Amazon Q Business application or data source. The value associated with the tag. The value may be an empty string but it can't be null.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: The key for the tag. Keys are not case sensitive and must be unique for the Amazon Q Business application or data source.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The value associated with the tag. The value may be an empty string but it can't be null.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A token that you provide to identify the request to create your Amazon Q Business application. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: attachmentsConfiguration
parameters.description: An option to allow end users to upload files directly during chat. Status information about whether file upload functionality is activated or deactivated for your end user.

nested_params.name: attachmentsControlMode
nested_params.description: Status information about whether file upload functionality is activated or deactivated for your end user.

parameters.name: qAppsConfiguration
parameters.description: An option to allow end users to create and use Amazon Q Apps in the web experience. Status information about whether end users can create and use Amazon Q Apps in the web experience.

nested_params.name: qAppsControlMode
nested_params.description: Status information about whether end users can create and use Amazon Q Apps in the web experience.

parameters.name: personalizationConfiguration
parameters.description: Configuration information about chat response personalization. For more information, see Personalizing chat responses An option to allow Amazon Q Business to customize chat responses using user specific metadata--specifically, location and job information--in your IAM Identity Center instance.

nested_params.name: personalizationControlMode
nested_params.description: An option to allow Amazon Q Business to customize chat responses using user specific metadata--specifically, location and job information--in your IAM Identity Center instance.

parameters.name: quickSightConfiguration
parameters.description: The Amazon QuickSight configuration for an Amazon Q Business application that uses QuickSight for authentication. This configuration is required if your application uses QuickSight as the identity provider. For more information, see Creating an Amazon QuickSight integrated application. The Amazon QuickSight namespace that is used as the identity provider. For more information about QuickSight namespaces, see Namespace operations.

nested_params.name: clientNamespace
nested_params.description: The Amazon QuickSight namespace that is used as the identity provider. For more information about QuickSight namespaces, see Namespace operations.

nested_items.name: applicationId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business application.

nested_items.name: applicationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Q Business application.
